plugins.name: SVG to Vue.js component
plugins.description:
Convert selected frames to .vue files with common props. Best for icons, logos and illustrations.


How to use

  1. Select frames
  2. Run plugin
  3. Customize export options
  4. Click «Download»
  5. Copy files to your project
  6. Use in your project <FrameName size="24px" style="color: black" />


Component props

size: String optional

width: String optional

height: String optional

<FrameIcon size="24px" />

<FrameIcon width="24px" />

<FrameIcon height="24px" />


Export options

‘.fill-current-color’ instead of grayscale fill

‘.stroke-current-color’ instead of grayscale stroke

Removes grayscale fill/stroke and adds class to the node. Only works if all fills/strokes in the frame are grayscale (if frame has a saturated fill/stroke color the entire frame will be ignored). Best for icons. Don't forget add css rules:

.fill-current-color { fill: currentColor }

.stroke-current-color { stroke: currentColor }


Remove masks

Removes all <mask> nodes


Remove frame clipPath

Sets overflow="visible" and removes clip-path. Useful when you want to keep the size of the frame, but there are elements that go beyond its borders. For example elements with a shadow


Github

plugins.name: FeedLabs
plugins.description:
The FeedLabs plugin helps you to quickly turn spreadsheets/csv files/feeds into beautiful creatives. Check out https://feedlabs.io for more!


How to

1) Create a template (frame), using Figma

2) Upload a CSV file with your items, using the plugin

3) Render the frame for all items in a few seconds


Features

  • Dynamic images; use image URLs to show a different image per item
  • Dynamic text; use fields inside text elements to show different text per item. (e.g. ${{price}},-)
  • Conditional rendering; show an element depending on a certain condition (e.g. 'sale' EQUAL true)
  • Render up to 50 items in a few seconds
  • Make infinite templates and designs, using Figma


FAQ

What is the pricing model?

The plugin in the current state will always be available for free.


What if I want to add more than 50 items?

This plugin is a free service and only allows limited features. However, we offer a service allowing processing of 100.000s of items in seconds, check out https://feedlabs.io for more!


Something is not working as expected, what do I do?

We love feedback! Please send an email to vanamerongen@squaremoon.nl and I will personally help you.


I need a feature which is not implemented, what do I do?

We are currently working very hard implementing many new features. However, if you have some useful suggestions, please send the to me at vanamerongen@squaremoon.nl.




Powered by SquareMoon B.V.
plugins.tagline: Turn spreadsheets into creatives with this creative automation plugin

plugins.name: Figma to Demo
plugins.description:
Folio is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of converting design file from a Figma canvas into a structured sequence of steps for creating demonstrations. We created this innovative tool as an extension to Folio that enhances your Figma workflow efficiency by automating the tedious task of manual step-by-step documentation for video tutorials, user guides, walkthroughs, and more.


Features

Image Sequence Import: Seamlessly import a sequence of images directly from your Figma canvas into the plugin. This eliminates the need to export images manually and ensures a smooth transition from design to video documentation.

Step Arrangement: The plugin intelligently organizes the imported images into a logical sequence, creating a smooth flow for your video demo. This saves you valuable time in arranging and rearranging steps manually.

Customizable Captions: While the plugin generates default step descriptions, you retain full control over the content inside the folio.la editor. You can easily edit and customize step captions to ensure they perfectly match the narrative of your video demo.

Timing and Transitions: Define each step's duration in the video and specify transitions between steps. This ensures that your video demonstration maintains a smooth and engaging pace.

Export & Embed Options: Once the steps are generated and refined, you can export or embed the sequence as a detailed storyboard or script. This flexibility allows you to work with a variety of video editing software.

Collaboration-Friendly: Collaborate seamlessly with team members. Share your generated steps, storyboard, or script with your production team for further enhancement and implementation.

Time-Saving Efficiency: The plugin significantly reduces the time and effort required to create informative and engaging video tutorials by automating the process of generating step-by-step video documentation.

Enhanced Communication: The plugin bridges the gap between design and documentation teams. Clear and concise video demo steps make it easier for teams to communicate complex processes and interactions.

Regular Updates: The plugin is built with growth in mind. Expect regular updates that add new features, enhance performance, and improve usability based on user feedback.

accepted.name: Folio Demo
accepted.description: An affordable & versatile demo creation platform, suitable for teams of all sizes. We're committed to building a GTM enablement platform.

plugins.tagline: Convert your Figma design file into an interactive demo

plugins.name: Segoe Fluent Icons Search
plugins.description:
🚨 Font Required

This plugin requires Microsoft’s Segoe Fluent Icons font to display icons correctly. Without it, glyphs will appear as empty boxes (□).

  1. Windows 11: No action needed—the font is preinstalled.
  2. Windows 10 & macOS: Download the font from Microsoft for use in design and development.


🔎 Segoe Fluent Icons Search

Segoe Fluent Icons Search makes working with the Fluent icons font in Figma a breeze.

  1. Quickly search Microsoft’s Segoe Fluent Icons
  2. Click to copy any icon glyph
  3. Paste into text layers for seamless use
  4. includes 1,470+ glyphs


🙋 FAQs

► Can I use this with macOS?

  1. Yes! You just need to download Microsoft's Segoe Fluent Icons font and install it. If you're on Windows 10, you'll also need to download the font.

► I installed the font, but I'm still seeing "□" instead of glyphs.

  1. You'll need to restart Figma and relaunch the plugin due to font caching.

► Can I download the SVGs of these icons?

  1. No, not through Segoe Fluent Icons Search—this plugin only allows you to preview and copy individual glyphs.

► A few of the glyphs are still showing as empty boxes (□).

  1. A few glyphs are only available on Windows 11, and not included directly in the downloadable Segoe Fluent Icon font.


This plugin is open-source.

accepted.name: Seth Cottle
accepted.description:
✈️ Product Design Lead at CLEAR. 
👤 He/Him

plugins.tagline: Browse and copy glyphs from Microsoft’s Segoe Fluent Icons font.

plugins.name: Spec.PDF
plugins.description:
Export frames to a PDF with outlines


You can choose one of two ways to sort the page order:

Hierarchy

Page order will follow the frame hierarchy from top to bottom, including sub-nodes.

Position

Page order will follow the frame position, sorted from top to bottom, then from left to right.


  1. Each label in the PDF outline will be the name of its corresponding frame.
  2. The conversion process runs locally in the browser. No network access.
plugins.tagline: Export frames to a PDF with outlines

plugins.name: Table Generator
plugins.description:
Instantly generate responsive tables with mock data to fit your design requirements.


Read Documentation | Watch Demo


Plugin Settings:

No. of Rows - Total number of rows required in the table.

Cell Width - Width of each cell in the table.

Cell Padding - Padding applied to each cell in the table.

Cell Alignment - Text alignment within each cell.

Striped Table - Option to enable zebra striping for the table.


Supported Data Types:


Blank Cell - Generates an empty cell.


Serial Number - Generates sequential numbers.

Ex: 1, 2, 3, ...


Name - Generates full names, providing options for first names, last names, and variations such as alphabetical order (A-Z), reverse alphabetical order (Z-A), and randomized sequences.

Ex: Alice Adams, Benjamin Brown, ...


Email - Generates email addresses with an option to provide custom domain names and variations such as alphabetical order (A-Z), reverse alphabetical order (Z-A), and randomized sequences.

Ex: alice.adams@example.com, benjamin.brown@somedomain.com, ...


List - Generates items from a list with variations such as alphabetical order (A-Z), reverse alphabetical order (Z-A), and randomized sequences.

Ex: Apple, Samsung, Google, ...


Date - Generates dates (randomized) with an option to pass custom year or year range (ex: 2004, 2004-2022) can be

Ex: 2024-06-22, 2024-Jun-22, ...


Date format tokens:

YYYY - Full year (e.g., 2024)

YY - Short year (e.g., 24)

MMM - Short month name (e.g., Jan)

MM - Month (e.g., 01 to 12)

DD - Day (e.g., 01 to 31)


Time - Generates times, randomized.

Ex: 13:45, 08:30 PM, ...


Time format tokens:

HH - Hours in 24-hour format (00 to 23)

hh - Hours in 12-hour format (01 to 12)

mm - Minutes (00 to 59)

ss - Seconds (00 to 59)

SSS - Milliseconds (000 to 999)

A - Period (AM or PM)


Timestamp - Generates timestamps, randomized.

Ex: 2024 Jun 21 08:39:16 AM, ...


Timestamp format tokens:

YYYY - Full year (e.g., 2024)

YY - Short year (e.g., 24)

MMM - Short month name (e.g., Jan)

MM - Month (e.g., 01 to 12)

DD - Day (e.g., 01 to 31)

HH - Hours in 24-hour format (00 to 23)

hh - Hours in 12-hour format (01 to 12)

mm - Minutes (00 to 59)

ss - Seconds (00 to 59)

SSS - Milliseconds (000 to 999)

A - Period (AM or PM)


Phone - Generates randomized phone numbers with customizable options including country code, phone number length, and starting digits.

Ex: +44 XXXXXXXXXX, ...


Number - Generates random numbers with options to specify maximum length and number range.

Ex: 1234566, 2344, ...


Price - Generates random prices within a specified range, allowing customization of currency prefix or suffix.

Ex: $ 200.00, 200.00 $, ...

accepted.name: Ismail Vittal
accepted.description: Product leader, developer & design specialist with a passion for creative technology, innovation and mentorship.

plugins.tagline: Effortlessly generate tables with mock data.

plugins.name: Clipboard: Copy/Paste Properties Plus Plus
plugins.description:
Clipboard is the Clipy for Figma.


  • Run the plugin and Select a node in the file
  • Copy Properties to Clipboard.
  • Paste them later anywhere in that file or a different one.
  • Double tap on properties to see details
  • Tap on settings to Remove or Rename
  • Filter node properties
  • Setting to see only file properties or all


  • Multi-Property Clipboard: Clipboard allows designers to copy and manage multiple node properties, breaking the limitations of single-node copying and pasting.
  • Cross-File Functionality: Seamlessly transfer node properties between different Figma files, enhancing your design workflow across projects.
  • Effortless Property Selection: Filter and organize the copied properties based on node types, making it easy to apply the right styles and elements to your design.
  • Reset Clipboard: Need a fresh start? Clipboard offers a quick and simple way to reset your clipboard, ensuring a clean slate for your next design task.

accepted.name: Sunny
accepted.description: Solving some of the use cases my team encounters when working in Figma.

plugins.tagline: Copy and manage multiple node properties across files

plugins.name: Classic Resume - Markdown to Figma - md2fig
plugins.description:
This plugin is suited for job seekers, designers, and anyone wanting a beautiful resume layout crafted directly in Figma from Markdown.

md2fig GitHub for Comments/PRs

With the "Classic Resume" plugin, users can:

  1. Create a Resume from Markdown: Quickly convert Markdown text into a professionally designed resume, streamlining the layout process and allowing users to focus on content rather than design.
  2. Customizable Templates: Access a classic resume template that can be tailored to fit personal branding, font preferences, and color schemes within Figma.
  3. Real-time Editing: Make live adjustments to text, layout, and design elements directly in Figma, ensuring a visually consistent and polished result without exporting to external tools.
  4. Designed for Simplicity: Ideal for those with minimal design experience, the plugin simplifies resume creation with easy-to-use settings, giving a structured and classic look with minimal effort.


Flexible Export Options: Export resumes as high-quality PDFs or images straight from Figma, ready for job applications or portfolio showcases.
plugins.tagline: Instantly transform Markdown into a classic Figma resume. Copy and Paste an elegant resume

plugins.name: Roller Coaster
plugins.description:
Prototype in FigJam? Now you can!


The maker of Tour Guide brings you Roller Coaster: A unique plugin that allows you to create simple clickable prototypes in FigJam and Figma by using connector arrows. It's simple!


  1. Create some objects.
  2. Connect them with FigJam connector arrows (copy and paste them from FigJam for use in Figma).
  3. Start the plugin!


When you turn on Roller Coaster, selecting a connected object will act as a 'click' that will 'transport you' to its next destination. This is great for walking through a flow. More instructions on how to use are included in the plugin.


Note: Nested objects require additional clicks to trigger the navigation.


If you've ever wanted to present a connector flow in FigJam or Figma, give this plugin a try!

accepted.name: Nelson Taruc
accepted.description: My design philosophy: Focus. Boost signal, kill noise. Solve the first problem. Embrace uncertainty.

plugins.name: Review Raven (AI design review partner)
plugins.description:
Review Raven is an AI review partner that can automatically analyse your Figma design screens such (websites, landing pages, email templates, UI/UX screens, social media posts) and provide you with quality feedback and design reviews with seconds so that you can design smarter and ship faster.


Feedback within seconds!⏱️

plugins.name: Pomodoro Timer
plugins.description:
The Pomodoro Timer is an awesome Figma plugin that helps you stay focused and motivated while working on your designs. Whether you're a professional designer, developer, or just someone who wants to increase productivity, the Pomodoro Timer is the perfect tool to help you stay on track.


This plugin uses the Pomodoro technique to divide your work into focused intervals of 25 minutes, followed by short breaks of 5 minutes. You can also choose longer breaks of 15 minutes after completing a certain number of pomodoros.


The Pomodoro Timer is super easy to use! Simply install the plugin, select the duration of the timer, and start working. You'll be amazed at how much more focused and productive you can be with this simple tool.

plugins.name: PonyUI Assets Export - Figma nodes to png, jpg, svg, svgr
plugins.description:
PonyUI Assets Export helps developers to export assets from Figma to local workspace! FAST and FREE!


✨ Save your time - Configure what should be exported inside Figma with our Figma plugin and export all assets with a single command.


📤 Simplified asset export - No more repetitive steps for each file like save file to disk, rename and copy to source folder.


⚛️ Automated React icons - Generate React icon components automatically, no more copy-pasting code to/from SVGR.


💻 Directly into your Local Workspace - our CLI tool will get all configured assets from your Figma file and save them in your source folder.


What you can do


  • You can export to png, jpg or svg files
  • You can set scale ratio for png & jpg assets
  • You can export any Figma node, doesn't matter what's inside. So you can compose different elements and export it as a single asset.
  • If you used SVGR to create React icon components from SVG files, PonyUI Assets Export will now do it for you.
  • Eslint and prettier supported for React icon components
  • PonyUI Assets Export will remember exported nodes, so you always know if a particular node is already exported in your source code and where to find it.
  • Inside the dev workspace you can configure different default folders for different types of assets.
  • And you can specify a custom folder for any special asset if you need it.


Usage


Inside the plugin


  • Open PonyUI Assets Export Plugin inside your Figma file.
  • Select a node you want to export in Figma and it appears in PonyUI Assets Export under the "Nodes" tab.
  • Under "Export as" combobox select any of png, jpg, svg or react-icon-component.
  • [Optional] It will fill File Name or Class Name text input automatically based on node's name, if you don't like the name, correct it.
  • [Optional] If you don't want it to be in a default path, please specify any relative path in your local workspace you want it to appear.
  • [Optional] For png & jpg assets if you want different scale than 2, set it.
  • Repeat steps 2-6 for each node you want to export.
  • Once done, open the "Publish" tab inside the Plugin and review changes you did.
  • Click "Save for Export" button and go to your local workspace.


In developer's local workspace


Install npm package & initialize it:


$ npm install --save-dev @ponyui/assets-export-cli
$ npx pa init


Import assets to your local workspace:


$ npx pa import



What's PonyUI


PonyUI is a toolchain aimed to automate the coding of your UI. It's going to be a small workhorse that converts Design to Code and vice versa to make Design File is the real "source of truth" for project's UI. Now we focus on a tool to convert Figma to React & React Native.


Our goal is to help software dev teams iterate faster and cheaper.
plugins.tagline: Batch export of assets right into dev workspace

plugins.name: VarVar
plugins.description:
VarVar is a Figma plugin that allows you to export your Figma variables to JSON, JS, CSV or CSS formats, making it easier to integrate your design tokens into your development workflow.


Features

  1. Export Figma variables to JSON, JS, CSV or CSS formats
  2. Identifies linked variables
  3. JSON: linked variables start with $.VARIABLE.PATH*
  4. JS: linked variables are referenced directly like collection.mode.variable (unquoted). Numeric paths are converted to bracket notation: collection.mode["500"]
  5. CSV: linked variables start with =VARIABLE/PATH*. CSV Option: “Use row & column positions”. This will produce instead a "formula-like" (i.e. =E7) linking in spreadsheet programs.
  6. CSS: linked variables will call CSS function var(--VARIABLE). Variable in collections with one single mode will be put into :root{}, otherwise they will have their own class, i.e. .collection--mode{}
  7. Preview exported data within the plugin interface
  8. Automatically download exported files


*Note: When dealing with linked variables that have multiple modes, the plugin will only link to the first occurrence (i.e., the first mode it finds).


Usage

Design Mode

  1. Open your Figma file containing variables
  2. Run the VarVar plugin from the Plugins menu
  3. Choose your desired export format (JSON, JS, CSV or CSS)
  4. Click "Export Variables"
  5. The exported file will be automatically downloaded


Dev Mode

  1. Open your Figma file containing variables
  2. Switch to Dev Mode
  3. Run the VarVar plugin from the Plugins menu
  4. Choose your desired export format (JSON, JS, CSV or CSS)
  5. Click "Export Variables"
  6. The exported file will be automatically downloaded


Preview and Copy

Toggle the "Preview output" switch to see the exported data within the plugin interface

Use the "Select to Copy" button and copy (Ctrl/Command + C) the exported data to your clipboard. (Programmatically copying is currently not supported by Figma Plugin APIs).


VarVar is open source, consider contributing. Code available on GitHub.

Bug report, suggestions, etc. Open an issue.

plugins.name: File Optimizer
plugins.description:
The File Optimizer plugin is a specialized tool to enhance the performance and organization of Figma files. This plugin is designed to streamline the file optimization process, ensuring your Figma documents are performance-optimized. Here's how File Optimizer can improve your Figma files:


Ungroup single-layer groups: This feature ungroups any group or groups of frames containing only one layer. It's ideal for reducing unnecessary group layers, simplifying your document structure and enhancing file performance.

Pixel-perfect alignment: By aligning all layers to the nearest pixel, this function eliminates blurry edges and ensures sharp, clear visuals. This is critical for maintaining high-quality graphics and improving the visual clarity of your designs.

Remove hidden layers: This tool removes all hidden layers from your document. This action not only declutters your file but also lightens the load on Figma's rendering engine, leading to better performance, especially in complex files.

Control Shadows: This feature streamlines the management of shadow effects in your Figma files. Hiding shadows can significantly reduce rendering load, especially in complex documents, leading to smoother interactions and faster load times.


If you are managing large-scale Figma files, this plugin ensures your documents are optimized for peak performance, making your design process smoother and more efficient.
plugins.tagline: Optimize with ease: clean, align, reveal

plugins.name: Figma to Droip (WordPress)
plugins.description:
Elevate your design process with the Figma-to-Droip plugin, a powerful collaboration tool that seamlessly transforms your static designs into fully functional websites.


How it works:

  1. Installation: Begin by installing the Figma-to-Droip plugin from the Resources tab in Figma.
  2. Copy + paste: For best results, create with auto layout in Figma then copy your design into Driop (command + v).
  3. Edit + Launch: Bring your designs to life within the Droip platform, utilizing its extensive features and capabilities. Fine-tune your website's elements, add interactivity, and with ease, launch your website to the world.


Naming Guidelines:

For the following element types, use these specific built-in element names in Figma for easy identification during import.


  1. Button: Button, button, BUTTON
  2. Form: Form, form, FORM
  3. Input: Input, input, INPUT
  4. Textarea: Textarea, textarea, TEXTAREA
  5. Link: Link, link, LINK
  6. Section: Section, section, SECTION
  7. Container: Container, container, CONTAINER


Additional Features:

  1. Seamless transfer of design components and styling from Figma to Droip.
  2. Access to Droip's comprehensive set of features and tools for website development.
  3. Effortlessly maintain design consistency and efficiency throughout the design-to-development process.
plugins.tagline: Transform your design from Figma to Droip

plugins.name: Art Director Toolkit
plugins.description:
Efficiently crank out designs and decks like a Bawse by automating tedious tasks like grid layouts, item distribution, block layouts, randomizing objects, and text cleanup.


Watch the tutorial videos here for a quick primer on the tools.


Auto Grid Layout Tool:

Crank out mood boards by laying out items in a variety of grid formats:

  • Basic Grid: Equal subdivision based on number of columns
  • Columns: Masonry grid layout based on columns. Column heights are adjusted to fit within margins.
  • Rows: Masonry grid layout based on rows. Row widths are adjusted to fit within margins.
  • Random: Interlocking grid layout. Seeded randomness creates predictable variations.
  • Auto Columns: Intelligently creates a column based grid while maintaining visual order of items.
  • Auto Rows: Intelligently creates a row based grid while maintaining visual order of items.


Distribute Tool:

Intelligently distribute items within the selection bounds with a desired gap. You can choose to have items maintain their size ratios and scale up/down to create the desired spacing. Or they can all resize to have an equal width/height with a desired spacing in between


Blockify Tool:

Blockify your selection with a single click either vertically or horizontally. The tool automatically detects the order of elements. The tool also intelligently scales text to fit the block based on the visual outlines of the text vs white space borders in the text.


Swap Fills:

Quickly swap the fills of two selected elements. If more than two elements are selected, the tool randomly swaps the fills among the selection.


Randomizer:

Add randomness to items based on position, rotation and scale. Set the min and max values for precise control. Seeded randomness creates predictable patterns.


Text Tools:

Text cleanup quickly removes extra spaces from a text block.

Make Single Para will remove any paragraph breaks from the selected text and turn everything into a single paragraph.


Color Hashtags:

Quickly add a desired color to all hashtags within the selected text/text blocks.


Send feature requests, bug reports, and suggestions to artdirectortoolkit@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Automate tedious design and layout tasks.

plugins.name: NeedsDesign for Pivotal Tracker
plugins.description:
Sync with Pivotal Tracker! Keep up with your product's backlog with mindful modularity.

💡Mindful Modularity:

Unburden yourself from the idea of having to build and maintain a monolithic prototype. They should be cheap, disposable, and serve only as a communication tool to validate user stories.

NeedsDesign:

Maintain focus on solving only the problem you currently have. NeedsDesign provides an opinionated workflow by displaying user stories that have a "needs design" label and creates a new page for each. Whether a feature or a bug, NeedsDesign helps to reinforce modularity in the design process and avoid the siren's song that is a single prototype that maintains parity with working software.

plugins.name: Figma Raw: Export Design Data for AI/LLM & Agents
plugins.description:
Bridge the gap between your Figma designs and the power of AI.

Figma Raw exports detailed information about your selected Figma elements into clean, structured JSON, ready to be used with any AI/LLM tool or AI coding agent like Cursor or Devin.


Why Figma Raw?

  1. Detailed & Accurate Export: Go beyond basic layers. Figma Raw extracts component names, properties, Auto Layout settings, and crucially, resolves the exact names of your Figma Variables (design tokens) and Text Styles.
  2. Seamless AI Integration: Simply copy the generated JSON (choose Pretty for readability or Minified to save tokens) and paste it into your favorite AI tool's prompt. Accelerate code generation, design analysis, documentation, and more.
  3. Design System Aware: Because Figma Raw includes the precise names from your design system (e.g., colors/primary/500, typography/body-large), you can instruct AI to generate code that perfectly aligns with your existing system, ensuring consistency.
  4. Generic & Future-Proof: This is a universal solution. Export once and use the JSON data across various LLMs and AI agents without being locked into a specific platform.
  5. Empower AI Agents: Provide AI agents like Cursor or Devin with the rich, structured design context they need to generate accurate, production-ready code directly from your Figma designs.


How it Works:

  1. Select the Figma nodes (frames, components, text, etc.) you want to export.
  2. Run the "Figma Raw" plugin.
  3. Copy the JSON data (Pretty or Minified).
  4. Paste it into your AI/LLM tool or agent.


Ideal for:

  1. Frontend Developers leveraging AI for code generation.
  2. Designers seeking accurate design handoffs to AI tools.
  3. Teams aiming to maintain design system consistency in AI-assisted workflows.
  4. Users of AI coding agents (Cursor, Devin, etc.) wanting to work directly from Figma designs.
plugins.tagline: The Universal Figma-to-JSON Bridge for Any LLM & AI Tool.

online pages


Description

This is a plugin to export figma style to design token json.


本插件用于将 figma 中定义的样式导出为 design token json.


How to use

Just select nodes using custom style then click export. And U will get a pretty json.


You can find more usage here.


Exports token to...

  • clipboard
  • json file
  • github pull request [new!]


Github Pull Request

To export token to github pr:

  1. Go to 'setting' and fill the github access token.
  2. Select styles.
  3. click 'Make a PR' button.
  4. config repo
  5. click 'Create PR' button.


Notice:

  • Your github access token need to have the access to create PR on master.
